Edward, the author of this test, had to escape from prison to work in the grading room today. He stopped to rest at a place $1,875$ feet from the prison and was spotted by a guard with a crossbow.\\
\\
The guard fired an arrow with an initial velocity of $100 \dfrac{\text{ft}}{\text{s}}$.  At the same time, Edward started running away with an acceleration of $1 \dfrac{\text{ft}}{\text{s}^2}$.  Assuming that air resistance causes the arrow to decelerate at $1 \dfrac{\text{ft}}{\text{s}^2}$, and that it does hit Edward, how fast was the arrow moving at the moment of impact (in $\dfrac{\text{ft}}{\text{s}}$)?
